topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5406579463687227ad040100#post_5406579463687227ad040100
I left disappointed.
The part that annoyed me the most was the airport scene.
The MOTO is causing havoc and everyone is screaming.
Then Godzilla's foot stomps down and everyone shuts up.
It sounds like the beggining of an epic battlle.
And we get to see the epic battle!
...
On a kid's TV.
For about 5 fucking seconds.

Then it's just another 20 minutes of 'humanity'.
Boorriiiiiing.

topics.body:

I didn't mind Aaron Taylor's character, in fact, I personally liked it. That being said; Cranston is Cranston. This was a sad case of someone's perfomance being done so well is difficult to top.
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

topics.body:
"@ParagonCommander":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54065858636872268a2f0100#post_54065858636872268a2f0100
I can see how that could bother you. I thought it was more funny than anything though. I feel like the fight would have been unsatisfying if it had been this ten minute long battle followed by the muto just flying away. Otherwise godzilla would have just killed it and there wouldn't be a fight with both of them at once. 

The sequel's going to have a crapload of monsters so such things shouldn't be an issue next time.

I want to think that was the point. Taylor's character is supposed to bottle up what he feels since he saw how his dad's emotions drived him insane and chasing something that until the whole thing blows up, is just a phantom chase.
